sub_topic: Identifying the perfect matching in a graph.
message_1:
Consider the following graph:

```
        A --- B
       / \   / \
      /   \ /   \
     C --- D --- E
```

What is the maximum number of edges that can be matched in this graph? And what is the matching that achieves this maximum?
message_2: In this graph, the maximum number of edges that can be matched is 2. One possible matching that achieves this maximum is the set of edges {A-B, C-D} or {A-D, B-E}. In both cases, two edges are matched, and no vertex is part of more than one matched edge.
